intro: Gilia brecciarum, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats, such as cliffs and talus slopes, in mountainous regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Gilia brecciarum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and cold temperatures.
